item.description:
I thought it would be fun to meet for a picnic at the Parkman Bandstand in Boston Commons and watch the production of Shakespear's "As You Like It." "As You Like It" explores status, power and the mystery of love. "This riotous romp through the Forest of Arden follows the adventures of Rosalind, a good-hearted optimist, and her pursuit for true love. From sorrow to laughter, banishment to marriage, the play involves conversations about life and love, and a clash of views, with a hilarious mixture of romantic and slapstick comedy. A play of passion, romance, and disguise, the game of love is tried until identities are revealed and all is resolved."

August 2nd is also the 3rd annual Celebrate Shakespeare Day, also at the Parkman Bandstand. "Celebrate Shakespeare Day is a multi-faceted free event featuring workshops, performances, backstage tours, and lectures for the public to enjoy and learn more about the works of William Shakespeare." Celebrate Shakespeare Day goes from 2:00 to 6:00 pm. I thought we could meet around 4:00 pm for the workshops and other things they have going on and then stay for the production which starts at 8:00 pm.

I'll be in front of the Parkman Bandstand at 4:00. We can meet there and then find a place to picnic and see the production. Bring blankets, chairs, umbrella (in case of rain), snacks and drinks (I don't think alcohol is allowed at the Commons).
